title: A person walks 25 degrees north of east for 3.18 km. How far would she have to walk due north and then due east to arrive at the same location? - Quora

response.answer_text: She will need to walk 1.342 km due North and then2.882 km due East in order to reach a point that lies 3.18 km further in her original direction. The question asks “to arrive at the same Station” .That is an impossibility. She will have to walk 1.342 km due South from where she reached after walking 3.18 km , and than Turn West from there and walk 2.882 km , in oprder to reach the same station from where she started. If she wants to return to the spot where she had reached after travelling 3.18 km, she will have to cover a total distance of 7.40 km , ie. 3.18 km in the directio of the original point from the point along the 25 degree line,where she reached after travelling due North and then due East.
